Header: Details of income generated by six major political parties of SL revealed (VIDEO)
Content: Ever wondered how much Sri Lankan political parties generate in income?  This article brings you just that of six parties in the country. Ceylon Workers Congress (CWC) Total income – Rs.115 million Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) Total income – Rs.87.1 million *JVP has methodically listed all information in a descriptive manner including the salaries of its MPs and income generated by the sale of vehicles. United National Party (UNP) Total income – Rs.36.3 million Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) Total income – Rs. 19.7 million United Peoples Freedom Alliance (UPFA) Total income – Rs.2.4 million *Generated through donations to the party. Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) Total income – Rs.1.8 million Jathika Hela Urumaya (JHU) Total income – Rs.1.8 million *Includes a sum of Rs. 213,880 – donated from the salary of party leader Patali Champika Ranawaka. Source – Campaign for Free and Fair Elections (CaFFE) How – Following information gathered by financial statements of political parties -under the Right to Information Act is as of 31st December 2015. * CaFFE notes that reports maintained by political parties lack transparency. * The organisation stressed on the importance of creating effective dialogue to demand more financial transparency.
